title: Manquechapac
content:
This is a latinamerican fusion rock band. From Santiago de Chile.  
I use the andean mountains rocks and texture. I think it is near to be finished, but i need some suggestions, specially on space or contrast..  
Can you help me on this and share some opinions?

[http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2017/1635/1600/Manque.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190658/http:/photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2017/1635/1600/Manque.gif "http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/2017/1635/1600/Manque.gif")

Best,

mh.
author: Miguel Hernandez

comments.content:
the link doesn't work.

edit: now I see it...
I still can't see it. We have inline images now ( with flash 8 installed ) CAn anybody post the image to the page?

Checkout here, in my blog:

[http://chilediseno.blogspot.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190658/http:/chilediseno.blogspot.com/ "http://chilediseno.blogspot.com")

Best,

mh.

here it is for all to see.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190658im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Manque.gif)

Here is my impression. Over all it seems really strong. Here are my suggestions for maybe improving it. Really, I don't know that they will:

• Maybe make the N a little wider.  
• I like the Q but I wonder what more could be done with it. It is a huge graphic opportunity  
• The ch - I wonder if the top of the c might bend down a little to help it read as a 'c' a bit more.  
• Maybe let the 1st M be a little bigger and let it be spaced a little farther from the 'a'.  
• What if the C on the inside was a bit rounder?

Sweet work!

Hey, this is pretty nice. Very balanced, in a dynamic way.

The only thing I would change is make the "N" not look like an "Ñ".

hhp
I like this. I agree with Hrant, I'd only correct the N. The accent needs to read a little better than that.

Actually, the thing is that there isn't an accent...

hhp

On the page he links to it has an accent.

"Mañquechapac"

Oh. That link doesn't work for me; and the thread title has an "n".  
Well, OK, then it's fine. :-) But you can have an "ñ" like that  
without a vowel following? I guess if you're a rock band you can.

hhp

Hola! Here is an Update:

[http://www.chiledesign.cl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108190658/http:/www.chiledesign.cl/ "http://www.chiledesign.cl/")

Thank you for your feedback,

mh.

i like the letterforms better in this new variant, because they're 'funkier'. i think the cursive elements to the 'm', 'k', 'c', and 'a' all lend to increased tension within the graphic.

because elements of the letterforms are at odds with one another, but not overtly so, this new version feels more dynamic to me.

but what's with the completely different spelling of the name? is it intended to be phonetic?

The spelling change is a bit odd, but I also like the 'chunkier-ness' of the second variation. Foating the tilde accent helps as well. The only nitpik I have is that the 'Q' seems to be a bit too dominant.

The new one is good too but the 1st thing I thought of was what if the A shapes were lc 'a'. I bet it would be streonger & more legible that way. Peronally I like the dominant Q. I don't know why. Maybe because it's funky.
